Lebesgue Integral
This file contains a formalization of the Lebesgue integral. It starts with simple functions and their integral, provides basic operations (addition, etc.), and proves the properties of their integral (semi-linearity, non-decreasingness). It then defines the integral of measurable functions, proves the approximation theorem, the properties of their integral (semi-linearity, non-decreasingness), the monotone convergence theorem, and Fatou's lemma. Finally, it proves the linearity properties of the integral, the dominated convergence theorem and Fubini's theorem.
Main reference:
  • Daniel Li, Int√©gration et applications, 2016
    {mfun T >-> R} == type of real-valued measurable functions {sfun T >-> R} == type of simple functions {nnsfun T >-> R} == type of non-negative simple functions cst_nnsfun r == constant simple function nnsfun0 := cst_nnsfun 0 sintegral mu f == integral of the function f with the measure mu \int[mu](x in D) f x == integral of the measurable function f over the domain D with measure mu \int[mu]_x f x := \int[mu](x in setT) f x dyadic_itv n k == the interval ` [(k%:R * 2 ^- n), (k.+1%:R * 2 ^- n) [ approx D f == nondecreasing sequence of functions that approximates f over D using dyadic intervals Rintegral mu D f := fine (\int[mu](x in D) f x). mu.-integrable D f == f is measurable over D and the integral of f w.r.t. D is < +oo ae_eq D f g == f is equal to g almost everywhere m1 \x m2 == product measure over T1 * T2, m1 is a measure measure over T1, and m2 is a sigma finite measure over T2 m1 \x^ m2 == product measure over T1 * T2, m2 is a measure measure over T1, and m1 is a sigma finite measure over T2

Lemma measurable_sfunP {d} {aT : measurableType d} {rT : realType}
  (f : {mfun aT >-> rT}) (Y : set rT) : measurable Y ‚Üí measurable (f @^-1` Y).

Section mfun_pred.
Context {d} {aT : measurableType d} {rT : realType}.
Definition mfun : {pred aT ‚Üí rT} := mem [set f | measurable_fun setT f].
Definition mfun_key : pred_key mfun.
Canonical mfun_keyed := KeyedPred mfun_key.
End mfun_pred.

Section mfun.
Context {d} {aT : measurableType d} {rT : realType}.
Notation T := {mfun aT >-> rT}.
Notation mfun := (@mfun _ aT rT).
Section Sub.
Context (f : aT ‚Üí rT) (fP : f \in mfun).
Definition mfun_Sub_subproof := @isMeasurableFun.Build d aT rT f (set_mem fP).
#[local] HB.instance Definition _ := mfun_Sub_subproof.
Definition mfun_Sub := [mfun of f].
End Sub.

Lemma mfun_rect (K : T ‚Üí Type) :
  (‚àÄ f (Pf : f \in mfun), K (mfun_Sub Pf)) ‚Üí ‚àÄ u : T, K u.

Lemma mfun_valP f (Pf : f \in mfun) : mfun_Sub Pf = f :> (_ ‚Üí _).

Canonical mfun_subType := SubType T _ _ mfun_rect mfun_valP.

Lemma mfuneqP (f g : {mfun aT >-> rT}) : f = g ‚Üî f =1 g.

Definition mfuneqMixin := [eqMixin of {mfun aT >-> rT} by <:].
Canonical mfuneqType := EqType {mfun aT >-> rT} mfuneqMixin.
Definition mfunchoiceMixin := [choiceMixin of {mfun aT >-> rT} by <:].
Canonical mfunchoiceType := ChoiceType {mfun aT >-> rT} mfunchoiceMixin.

Lemma cst_mfun_subproof x : @isMeasurableFun d aT rT (cst x).
Definition cst_mfun x := [the {mfun aT >-> rT} of cst x].

Lemma mfun_cst x : @cst_mfun x =1 cst x.


End mfun.

Canonical mfun_add := AddrPred mfun_subring_closed.

Canonical mfun_mul := MulrPred mfun_subring_closed.

Definition mfun_ringMixin := [ringMixin of {mfun aT >-> rT} by <:].

Definition mfun_comRingMixin := [comRingMixin of {mfun aT >-> rT} by <:].

Implicit Types (f g : {mfun aT >-> rT}).

Lemma mfun0 : (0 : {mfun aT >-> rT}) =1 cst 0 :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfun1 : (1 : {mfun aT >-> rT}) =1 cst 1 :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfunN f : - f = \- f :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfunD f g : f + g = f \+ g :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfunB f g : f - g = f \- g :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfunM f g : f √ó g = f \* g :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma mfun_sum I r (P : {pred I}) (f : I ‚Üí {mfun aT >-> rT}) (x : aT) :
  (\sum_(i <- r | P i) f i) x = \sum_(i <- r | P i) f i x.
Lemma mfun_prod I r (P : {pred I}) (f : I ‚Üí {mfun aT >-> rT}) (x : aT) :
  (\sum_(i <- r | P i) f i) x = \sum_(i <- r | P i) f i x.
Lemma mfunX f n : f ^+ n = (fun x ‚áí f x ^+ n) :> (_ ‚Üí _).


Definition mindic (D : set aT) of measurable D : aT ‚Üí rT := \1_D.
Lemma mindicE (D : set aT) (mD : measurable D) :
  mindic mD = (fun x ‚áí (x \in D)%:R).
Lemma indic_mfun_subproof (D : set aT) (mD : measurable D) :
  @isMeasurableFun d aT rT (mindic mD).

Definition indic_mfun (D : set aT) (mD : measurable D) :=
  [the {mfun aT >-> rT} of mindic mD].

Definition scale_mfun k f := [the {mfun aT >-> rT} of k \o√ó f].

Lemma max_mfun_subproof f g : @isMeasurableFun d aT rT (f \max g).
Definition max_mfun f g := [the {mfun aT >-> _} of f \max g].

End ring.

Section sfun.

  @isMeasurableFun.Build d aT rT f (set_mem (sub_sfun_mfun fP)).

Definition sfun_Sub2_subproof :=
  @FiniteImage.Build aT rT f (set_mem (sub_sfun_fimfun fP)).
#[local] HB.instance Definition _ := sfun_Sub2_subproof.
Definition sfun_Sub := [sfun of f].
End Sub.

Lemma fctD (T : pointedType) (K : ringType) (f g : T ‚Üí K) : f + g = f \+ g.

Lemma fctM (T : pointedType) (K : ringType) (f g : T ‚Üí K) : f √ó g = f \* g.

   k *: f = k \*: f.

Lemma fset_set_comp (T1 : Type) (T2 T3 : choiceType) (D : set T1)
    (f : {fimfun T1 >-> T2}) (g : T2 ‚Üí T3) :
  fset_set [set (g \o f) x | x in D] =
  [fset g x | x in fset_set [set f x | x in D]]%fset.

Lemma preimage_nnfun0 T (R : realDomainType) (f : {nnfun T >-> R}) t :
  t < 0 ‚Üí f @^-1` [set t] = set0.

Lemma preimage_cstM T (R : realFieldType) (x y : R) (f : T ‚Üí R) :
  x != 0 ‚Üí (cst x \* f) @^-1` [set y] = f @^-1` [set y / x].

Lemma preimage_add T (R : numDomainType) (f g : T ‚Üí R) z :
  (f \+ g) @^-1` [set z] = \bigcup_(a in f @` setT)
    ((f @^-1` [set a]) `&` (g @^-1` [set z - a])).

Definition nnsfun0 : {nnsfun T >-> R} := cst_nnsfun 0%R%:nng.

Lemma indic_nnfun_subproof (D : set T) : @isNonNegFun T R (\1_D).


End nnsfun_functions.
Arguments nnsfun0 {d T R}.

Section nnfun_bin.

End nnfun_bin.

Section nnsfun_bin.

Definition max_nnsfun := [the {nnsfun T >-> R} of f \max g].

End nnsfun_bin.
Arguments add_nnsfun {d T R} _ _.

Arguments max_nnsfun {d T R} _ _.

Section nnsfun_iter.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType) (D : set T).
Variable f : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat.

Definition sum_nnsfun n := \big[add_nnsfun/nnsfun0]_(i < n) f i.

Lemma sum_nnsfunE n t : sum_nnsfun n t = \sum_(i < n) (f i t).

Definition bigmax_nnsfun n := \big[max_nnsfun/nnsfun0]_(i < n) f i.

Lemma bigmax_nnsfunE n t : bigmax_nnsfun n t = \big[maxr/0]_(i < n) (f i t).

End nnsfun_iter.

Section nnsfun_cover.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

Lemma nnsfun_cover :
  \big[setU/set0]_(i \in range f) (f @^-1` [set i]) = setT.

Lemma nnsfun_coverT :
  \big[setU/set0]_(i \in [set: R]) (f @^-1` [set i]) = setT.

End nnsfun_cover.

Lemma measurable_sfun_inP {d} {aT : measurableType d} {rT : realType}
   (f : {mfun aT >-> rT}) D (y : rT) :
  measurable D ‚Üí measurable (D `&` f @^-1` [set y]).

  solve [apply: measurable_sfun_inP; assumption] : core.

Section measure_fsbig.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variable m : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}.

Lemma measure_fsbig (I : choiceType) (A : set I) (F : I ‚Üí set T) :
  finite_set A ‚Üí
  (‚àÄ i, A i ‚Üí measurable (F i)) ‚Üí trivIset A F ‚Üí
  m (\big[setU/set0]_(i \in A) F i) = \sum_(i \in A) m (F i).

Lemma additive_nnsfunr (g f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) x :
  \sum_(i \in range g) m (f @^-1` [set x] `&` (g @^-1` [set i])) =
  m (f @^-1` [set x] `&` \big[setU/set0]_(i \in range g) (g @^-1` [set i])).

Lemma additive_nnsfunl (g f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) x :
  \sum_(i \in range g) m (g @^-1` [set i] `&` (f @^-1` [set x])) =
  m (\big[setU/set0]_(i \in range g) (g @^-1` [set i]) `&` f @^-1` [set x]).

End measure_fsbig.

Section mulem_ge0.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

Let mulef_ge0 (R : realDomainType) x (f : R ‚Üí \bar R) :
  0 ‚â§ f x ‚Üí ((x < 0)%R ‚Üí f x = 0) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó f x.

Lemma nnfun_muleindic_ge0 d (T : measurableType d) (R : realDomainType)
  (f : {nnfun T >-> R}) r z : 0 ‚â§ r%:E √ó (\1_(f @^-1` [set r]) z)%:E.

Lemma mulemu_ge0 d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType)
    (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}) x (A : R ‚Üí set T) :
  ((x < 0)%R ‚Üí A x = set0) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó mu (A x).
Global Arguments mulemu_ge0 {d T R mu x} A.

    (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}) (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) x :
  0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).
End mulem_ge0.

Definition of Simple Integrals

Section simple_fun_raw_integral.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : Type) (R : numDomainType) (mu : set T ‚Üí \bar R) (f : T ‚Üí R).

Definition sintegral := \sum_(x \in [set: R]) x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).

Lemma sintegralET :
  sintegral = \sum_(x \in [set: R]) x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).

End simple_fun_raw_integral.

#[global] Hint Extern 0 (is_true (0 ‚â§ (_ : {measure set _ ‚Üí \bar _}) _)%E) ‚áí
  solve [apply: measure_ge0] : core.

Section sintegral_lemmas.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variable mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

Lemma sintegralE f :
  sintegral mu f = \sum_(x \in range f) x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).

Lemma sintegral0 : sintegral mu (cst 0%R) = 0.

Lemma sintegral_ge0 (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) : 0 ‚â§ sintegral mu f.

Lemma sintegral_indic (A : set T) : sintegral mu \1_A = mu A.

Lemma sintegralEnnsfun (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) : sintegral mu f =
  (\sum_(x \in [set r | r > 0]%R) (x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x])))%E.

End sintegral_lemmas.

Lemma eq_sintegral d (T : measurableType d) (R : numDomainType)
     (mu : set T ‚Üí \bar R) g f :
   f =1 g ‚Üí sintegral mu f = sintegral mu g.
Arguments eq_sintegral {d T R mu} g.

Section sintegralrM.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

Lemma sintegralrM : sintegral m (cst r \* f)%R = r%:E √ó sintegral m f.

End sintegralrM.

Section sintegralD.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variables (m : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).
Variables (D : set T) (mD : measurable D) (f g : {nnsfun T >-> R}).

Lemma sintegralD : sintegral m (f \+ g)%R = sintegral m f + sintegral m g.

End sintegralD.

Section le_sintegral.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType) (m : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).
Variables f g : {nnsfun T >-> R}.
Hypothesis fg : ‚àÄ x, f x ‚â§ g x.

Let fgnn : @isNonNegFun T R (g \- f).
#[local] HB.instance Definition _ := fgnn.

Lemma le_sintegral : (sintegral m f ‚â§ sintegral m g)%E.

End le_sintegral.

Lemma is_cvg_sintegral d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType)
  (m : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}) (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat) :
  (‚àÄ x, nondecreasing_seq (f ^~ x)) ‚Üí cvg (sintegral m \o f).

Definition proj_nnsfun d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType)
    (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) (A : set T) (mA : measurable A) :=
  mul_nnsfun f (indic_nnsfun R mA).

Definition mrestrict d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType) (f : {nnsfun T >-> R})
  A (mA : measurable A) : f \_ A = proj_nnsfun f mA.

Definition scale_nnsfun d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType)
    (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) (k : R) (k0 : 0 ‚â§ k) :=
  mul_nnsfun (cst_nnsfun T (NngNum k0)) f.

Section integral.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Implicit Types (f g : T ‚Üí \bar R) (D : set T).

Let nnintegral mu f := ereal_sup [set sintegral mu h |
  h in [set h : {nnsfun T >-> R} | ‚àÄ x, (h x)%:E ‚â§ f x]].

Definition integral mu D f (g := f \_ D) :=
  nnintegral mu (g ^\+) - nnintegral mu (g ^\-).

Variable (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).

Let nnintegral_ge0 f : (‚àÄ x, 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ nnintegral mu f.

Let eq_nnintegral g f : f =1 g ‚Üí nnintegral mu f = nnintegral mu g.

Let nnintegral0 : nnintegral mu (cst 0) = 0.

Let nnintegral_nnsfun (h : {nnsfun T >-> R}) :
  nnintegral mu (EFin \o h) = sintegral mu h.


Lemma eq_integral D g f : {in D, f =1 g} ‚Üí
  \int_(x in D) f x = \int_(x in D) g x.

Lemma ge0_integralE D f : (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  \int_(x in D) f x = nnintegral mu (f \_ D).

Lemma ge0_integralTE f : (‚àÄ x, 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  \int_(x in setT) f x = nnintegral mu f.

Lemma integralE D f :
  \int_(x in D) f x = \int_(x in D) (f ^\+ x) - \int_(x in D) f ^\- x.

Lemma integral0 D : \int_(x in D) (cst 0 x) = 0.

Lemma integral0_eq D f :
  (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí f x = 0) ‚Üí \int_(x in D) f x = 0.

Lemma integral_ge0 D f : (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ \int_(x in D) f x.

Lemma integral_nnsfun D (mD : measurable D) (h : {nnsfun T >-> R}) :
  \int_(x in D) (h x)%:E = sintegral mu (h \_ D).

End integral.

Notation "\int [ mu ]_ ( x 'in' D ) f" :=
  (integral mu D (fun x ‚áí f)) : ereal_scope.
Notation "\int [ mu ]_ x f" :=
  ((integral mu setT (fun x ‚áí f)))%E : ereal_scope.
Arguments eq_integral {d T R mu D} g.

Section dyadic_interval.

  `[(k%:R √ó 2 ^- n), (k.+1%:R √ó 2 ^- n)[.

  [set` I n.+1 k.*2] `|` [set` I n.+1 k.*2.+1].

Section approximation.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variables (D : set T) (mD : measurable D).
Variables (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) (mf : measurable_fun D f).


Let A n k := if (k < n √ó 2 ^ n)%N then
  D `&` [set x | f x \in EFin @` [set` I n k]] else set0.

Let B n := D `&` [set x | n%:R%:E ‚â§ f x]%E.

Definition approx : (T ‚Üí R)^nat := fun n x ‚áí
  \sum_(k < n √ó 2 ^ n) k%:R √ó 2 ^- n √ó \1_(A n k) x + n%:R √ó \1_(B n) x.

technical properties of the sets A and B
Let mA n k : measurable (A n k).

Let trivIsetA n : trivIset setT (A n).

Let f0_A0 n (i : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) x : f x = 0%:E ‚Üí i != O :> nat ‚Üí
  \1_(A n i) x = 0 :> R.

Let fgen_A0 n x (i : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : (n%:R%:E ‚â§ f x)%E ‚Üí
  \1_(A n i) x = 0 :> R.

Let disj_A0 x n (i k : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : i != k ‚Üí x \in A n k ‚Üí
  \1_(A n i) x = 0 :> R.
Arguments disj_A0 {x n i} k.

Let mB n : measurable (B n).

Let foo_B1 x n : D x ‚Üí f x = +oo%E ‚Üí \1_(B n) x = 1 :> R.

Let f0_B0 x n : f x = 0%:E ‚Üí n != 0%N ‚Üí \1_(B n) x = 0 :> R.

Let fgtn_B0 x n : (f x < n%:R%:E)%E ‚Üí \1_(B n) x = 0 :> R.

Let f0_approx0 n x : f x = 0%E ‚Üí approx n x = 0.

Let fpos_approx_neq0 x : D x ‚Üí (0%E < f x < +oo)%E ‚Üí
  \‚àÄ n \near \oo, approx n x != 0.

Let f_ub_approx n x : (f x < n%:R%:E)%E ‚Üí
  approx n x == 0 ‚à® ‚àÉ k,
    [/\ (0 < k < n √ó 2 ^ n)%N,
       x \in A n k, approx n x = k%:R / 2 ^+ n &
       f x \in EFin @` [set` I n k]].

Let notinD_approx0 x n : ¬¨ D x ‚Üí approx n x = 0 :> R.

Lemma nd_approx : nondecreasing_seq approx.

Lemma cvg_approx x (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) : D x ‚Üí
  (f x < +oo)%E ‚Üí (approx^~ x) --> fine (f x).

Lemma le_approx k x (f0 : ‚àÄ x, (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) : D x ‚Üí
  ((approx k x)%:E ‚â§ f x)%E.

Lemma dvg_approx x : D x ‚Üí f x = +oo%E ‚Üí ¬¨ cvg (approx^~ x : _ ‚Üí R^o).

Lemma ecvg_approx (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) x :
  D x ‚Üí EFin \o approx^~x --> f x.

Let k2n_ge0 n (k : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : 0 ‚â§ k%:R √ó 2 ^- n :> R.

Definition nnsfun_approx : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat := fun n ‚áí locked (add_nnsfun
  (sum_nnsfun
    (fun k ‚áí match Bool.bool_dec (k < (n √ó 2 ^ n))%N true with
      | left h ‚áí scale_nnsfun (indic_nnsfun _ (mA n k)) (k2n_ge0 (Ordinal h))
      | right _ ‚áí nnsfun0
     end) (n √ó 2 ^ n)%N)
  (scale_nnsfun (indic_nnsfun _ (mB n)) (ler0n _ n))).

Lemma nnsfun_approxE n : nnsfun_approx n = approx n :> (T ‚Üí R).

Lemma cvg_nnsfun_approx (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) x :
  D x ‚Üí EFin \o nnsfun_approx^~x --> f x.

Lemma nd_nnsfun_approx : nondecreasing_seq (nnsfun_approx : (T ‚Üí R)^nat).

Lemma approximation : (‚àÄ t, D t ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f t)%E) ‚Üí
  ‚àÉ g : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat, nondecreasing_seq (g : (T ‚Üí R)^nat) ‚àß
                        (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí EFin \o g^~x --> f x).

End approximation.

Section integralB.

                  \int[mu]_(x in D) f1 x - \int[mu]_(x in D) f2 x.

  \sum_(n <oo) `|\int[\d_ n]_x a x| < +oo.

Section subadditive_countable.

Lemma integrable_summable (F : (set T)^nat) (g : T ‚Üí \bar R):
  trivIset setT F ‚Üí (‚àÄ k, measurable (F k)) ‚Üí
  mu.-integrable (\bigcup_k F k) g ‚Üí
  summable [set: nat] (fun i ‚áí \int[mu]_(x in F i) g x).

Lemma integral_bigcup (F : (set _)^nat) (g : T ‚Üí \bar R) :
  trivIset setT F ‚Üí (‚àÄ k, measurable (F k)) ‚Üí
  mu.-integrable (\bigcup_k F k) g ‚Üí
  (\int[mu]_(x in \bigcup_i F i) g x = \sum_(i <oo) \int[mu]_(x in F i) g x)%E.

End subadditive_countable.

Section dominated_convergence_lemma.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variables (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}) (D : set T) (mD : measurable D).

Hypothesis mf_ : ‚àÄ n, measurable_fun D (f_ n).
Hypothesis f_f : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí f_ ^~ x --> f x.
Hypothesis fing : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí g x \is a fin_num.
Hypothesis ig : mu.-integrable D g.
Hypothesis absfg : ‚àÄ n x, D x ‚Üí `|f_ n x| ‚â§ g x.

Let g0 x : D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ g x.

Let mf : measurable_fun D f.


Let g_ n x := `|f_ n x - f x|.

Let cvg_g_ x : D x ‚Üí g_ ^~ x --> 0.

Let gg_ n x : D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ 2%:E √ó g x - g_ n x.

Let mgg n : measurable_fun D (fun x ‚áí 2%:E √ó g x - g_ n x).

Let gg_ge0 n x : D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ 2%:E √ó g x - g_ n x.



End dominated_convergence_lemma.

Section dominated_convergence_theorem.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Context d (T : measurableType d) (R : realType).
Variables (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}) (D : set T) (mD : measurable D).
Variables (f_ : (T ‚Üí \bar R)^nat) (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) (g : T ‚Üí \bar R).
Hypothesis mf_ : ‚àÄ n, measurable_fun D (f_ n).
Hypothesis mf : measurable_fun D f.
Hypothesis f_f : {ae mu, ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí f_ ^~ x --> f x}.
Hypothesis ig : mu.-integrable D g.
Hypothesis f_g : {ae mu, ‚àÄ x n, D x ‚Üí `|f_ n x| ‚â§ g x}.

Let g_ n x := `|f_ n x - f x|.

Theorem dominated_convergence : [/\ mu.-integrable D f,
  [sequence \int[mu]_(x in D) (g_ n x)]_n --> 0 &
  [sequence \int[mu]_(x in D) (f_ n x)]_n --> \int[mu]_(x in D) (f x) ].

End dominated_convergence_theorem.

Section fubini.

  (m1 \x m2).-integrable setT f ‚Üî \int[m1]_x \int[m2]_y `|f (x, y)| < +oo.

/NB: only relies on mf

Lemma ae_integrable1 :
  {ae m1, ‚àÄ x, m2.-integrable setT (fun y ‚áí f (x, y))}.

Lemma ae_integrable2 :
  {ae m2, ‚àÄ y, m1.-integrable setT (fun x ‚áí f (x, y))}.

Let F := fubini_F m2 f.

Let Fplus x := \int[m2]_y f^\+ (x, y).
Let Fminus x := \int[m2]_y f^\- (x, y).

Let FE : F = Fplus \- Fminus.

Let measurable_Fplus : measurable_fun setT Fplus.

Let measurable_Fminus : measurable_fun setT Fminus.

Lemma measurable_fubini_F : measurable_fun setT F.

Let integrable_Fplus : m1.-integrable setT Fplus.

Let integrable_Fminus : m1.-integrable setT Fminus.

Lemma integrable_fubini_F : m1.-integrable setT F.

Let G := fubini_G m1 f.

Let Gplus y := \int[m1]_x f^\+ (x, y).
Let Gminus y := \int[m1]_x f^\- (x, y).

Let GE : G = Gplus \- Gminus.

Let measurable_Gplus : measurable_fun setT Gplus.

Let measurable_Gminus : measurable_fun setT Gminus.

Lemma measurable_fubini_G : measurable_fun setT G.

Let integrable_Gplus : m2.-integrable setT Gplus.

Let integrable_Gminus : m2.-integrable setT Gminus.

Lemma fubini1 : \int[m1]_x F x = \int[m1 \x m2]_z f z.

Lemma fubini2 : \int[m2]_x G x = \int[m1 \x m2]_z f z.

Theorem Fubini :
  \int[m1]_x \int[m2]_y f (x, y) = \int[m2]_y \int[m1]_x f (x, y).

End fubini.
